title: Manual: Give lists of items/attributes some type of order
body:
Lists of items on the std docs should be sorted in some fashion. Alphabetical sorting throughout may not be desirable but I thought I should list all of them here anyway. If other sorting methods are better, I could create more categories.

Lists which are sorted alphabetically:
- [x] [Crate-only attributes](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#crate-only-attributes)
- [x] [Module-only attributes](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#module-only-attributes)
- [x] [Function-only attributes](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#function-only-attributes)
- [x] [Static-only attributes](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#static-only-attributes)
- [x] [FFI attributes](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#ffi-attributes)
- [x] [Miscellaneous attributes](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#miscellaneous-attributes)
- [x] [Conditional compilation](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#conditional-compilation)
- [x] [Lint check attributes](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#lint-check-attributes)
- [x] [Built-in Traits](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#built-in-traits)
- [x] ~~[Operators](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#operators) (alphabetical may not make sense here)~~
- [x] [Types](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#types)
- [x] [Marker types](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#marker-types)
- [x] [Inline attributes](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#inline-attributes)
- [x] [Deriving](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#deriving)
- [x] ~~[Stability](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#stability) (stability is sorted by stability)~~
- [x] [Compiler Features](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#compiler-features)

---

In [Marker types](http://doc.rust-lang.org/rust.html#marker-types):

> no_copy_bound : This type does not implement "copy", even if eligible
> no_send_bound : This type does not implement "send", even if eligible
> no_sync_bound : This type does not implement "sync", even if eligible
> managed_bound : This type implements "managed"

**managed_bound** should be first.
